column4: When I type sudo mount /dev/sda3 /mnt && sudo grub-install --root-directory=/mnt /dev/sda it says "mount: you must specify the filesystem type", Ubuntu is on /dev/sda3 and I'm trying to reinstall grub on /dev/sda

When I type sudo mount /dev/sda3 /mnt && sudo grub-install --root-directory=/mnt /dev/sda it says "mount: you must specify the filesystem type", Ubuntu is on /dev/sda3 and I'm trying to reinstall grub on /dev/sda, can anyone help me? :(
bucky: Is this correct? sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/sda5 /mnt && sudo grub-install --root-directory=/mnt /dev/sda
